entries.title: The environment and Africa: Hollywood plays a cunning game of manipulation and wins
entries.description: 'Avatar' and 'Black Panther' are meant to be enough to settle the studios' accounts as far as climate, minorities and even Western imperialism are concerned.

entries.title: The ton of cocaine, the sailboat and the 'innocent'
entries.description: French and Spanish police officers uncovered an international cocaine-importing network composed of a motley crew.

entries.title: Marine Le Pen does not want to be 'locked in'  at Assemblée Nationale
entries.description: Already looking ahead to the presidential election of 2027, the leader of the far-right Rassemblement National MPs at the Assemblée Nationale has resumed her travels in France and abroad.

entries.title: Czech presidential election marks end of Zeman era, with its abuses of power
entries.description: Three candidates, including the populist former prime minister Andrej Babis, are in a tight race to replace the outgoing president, who has been in power for 10 years.

entries.title: US expected to hit debt limit Thursday: Treasury Department
entries.description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned the Treasury will need to begin 'extraordinary measures' to prevent a default if it hits the limit.

entries.title: Apple boss Tim Cook accepts more than 40% pay cut
entries.description: The technology giant says its CEO requested the cut himself after criticism from shareholders.

entries.title: Man pleads guilty for attempted egging of King Charles
entries.description: Another man is also pending trial for attempting to strike the British monarch by hurling eggs.

entries.title: 'Pokémon' series ends after 25 years and 1,200 episodes
entries.description: After more than 1,200 episodes, the adventures of Sacha and Pikachu are coming to a close.

entries.title: Greta Thunberg visits German village being cleared for coal mine
entries.description: The Swedish climate campaigner held up a placard bearing the words 'Keep it in the ground' in reference to the open coal mine, as some protesters remained in treehouses.

entries.title: US judge fines Trump Organization $1.6 million for tax fraud
entries.description: The former president's firm was fined for running a scheme to defraud and evade taxes through falsifying business records.

entries.title: In response to Covid-19 outbreak, China 'suggests' reintroducing domestic travel controls
entries.description: Authorities are braced for a surge in coronavirus infections during the upcoming Lunar New Year, when hundreds of millions of Chinese will travel to see family for the holidays.

entries.title: Man City footballer Mendy cleared of six counts of rape, facing retrial for other charges
entries.description: Manchester City and France footballer Benjamin Mendy was told on Friday that he will be retried later this year for one further count of rape and another of attempted rape.

entries.title: Greece claims divisive debate to recover  Parthenon Marbles 'not closed'
entries.description: Pope Francis weighed into the lopng-standing row in December, when he decided to return three of the ancient Parthenon pieces to Greece.

entries.title: EU mulls adding Iran's Revolutionary Guards to list of terrorist groups
entries.description: The debate in Brussels shows the willingness of European leaders to increase their pressure on Tehran, amid ongoing repression in the country.

entries.title: Greek court drops spying charges against migrant rescuers
entries.description: Among those charged was Syrian swimmer Sarah Mardini, who along with the other activists still faces another investigation.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Russia says it has taken control of Soledar
entries.description: Both sides experienced heavy losses in the battle over the salt mine town and Ukraine has yet to confirm the Russian victory.

entries.title: French pension reform: The mother of all social battles
entries.description: A broad coalition is unhappy with President Emmanuel Macron's pension reform, but it remains unclear if the left and trade unions are strong enough to present a united front.

entries.title: 'Qatargate': European Parliament wants to ban lobbying by MEPs after they leave office
entries.description: The Belgian justice system continues to investigate the corruption scandal. After Qatar and Morocco, Mauritania appears to have been involved.

entries.title: US Republicans determined to track down Hunter Biden scandal
entries.description: An investigation is already targeting the son of US President Joe Biden in a tax evasion case, but it is his business activities in Ukraine and China that fuel most of the theories around him.

entries.title: Biden administration ruffled by discovery of classified documents
entries.description: A special counsel has been appointed to investigate the US president for the handling of these documents, dating back to his time as Barack Obama's vice president.

entries.title: Is the French pension reform dictated by Brussels?
entries.description: France has made several commitments to the European Commission to reform its pension system, but can we really say that the EU is forcing it to do so?

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Kyiv and its allies fear a new Russian mobilization
entries.description: Military experts have said that this new wave of soldiers, though inexperienced, would be difficult to contain.

entries.title: Why are US states banning TikTok?
entries.description: Almost half of all states banned the app from state-owned devices, in addition to it being banned on most federal-owned and military devices.

entries.title: Climate: The last eight years are the warmest on record
entries.description: According to the World Meteorological Organization, 2022 ranks as the fifth or sixth warmest year since measurements began.

entries.title: Nouriel Roubini: 'We are entering the great stagflation'
entries.description: Inflation, trade war, global warming... The American economist, known for his pessimism, lists in his latest book the major threats facing economies in the coming years.

entries.title: 'Despite what they say and perhaps dream, Harry and Meghan have not managed to break free'
entries.description: The fallen prince and his wife 'are not Romeo and Juliet fighting against the Montagues and the Capulets. Love is not the only thing that interests them,' says sociologist Jean-Claude Kaufmann.

entries.title: ExxonMobil has had reliable global warming projections since the 1970s
entries.description: Modelling carried out by the oil and gas company has enabled it to assess the scale of global warming, while its official statements have been built on climate denial.

entries.title: Morocco accuses Spanish journalist of 'boasting'
entries.description: Morocco has accused Ignacio Cembrero of lying when he said he was spied on by Morocco using the powerful spyware Pegasus.

entries.title: Pensions: 'The reform is courageous and will be difficult'
entries.description: Franck Morel, former social adviser to Prime Minister Edouard Philippe, recommends that the Borne government's reform be accompanied by a more ambitious plan to promote the employment of seniors.

entries.title: Chinese citizens are desperate for antiviral Covid-19 drugs
entries.description: With the recent explosion of Covid-19 cases, some people are seeking antiviral drugs, hoping to save elderly relatives.

entries.title: A year after 'Bloody January', Kazakhstan wants its citizens to forget
entries.description: President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev would prefer to turn the page on the deadly uprising of January 2022, as well as his promises of democratization.

entries.title: Paris commuters brace for travel woes during year of major rail works
entries.description: For 2023, an unprecedented amount of maintenance has been planned on rail networks in the Paris region, which will have a significant impact on commuters.

entries.title: Lisa Marie Presley, singer and only daughter of Elvis, dies at 54
entries.description: Ms. Presley shared her father's brooding charisma and released her own rock albums in the 2000s.

entries.title: Severe storm slamming the south of the US kills at least 6 people in Alabama
entries.description: There were multiple tornado warnings issued Thursday in Alabama, Mississippi and Tennessee as the storm system moved through the region.

entries.title: In Benin, pro-government parties win a parliament majority
entries.description: In a vote markign the return of the opposition after four years of absense, political parties supporting President Patrice Talon won 81 out of 109 seats.

entries.title: IMF chief warns that unemployment could be on the rise
entries.description: IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva said that central banks still have work to in their inflation battle, which could hit the labor market.
